intro: Amsinckia mexicana, commonly known as Mexican fumewort, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has slender, branching stems and produces small, yellow to brown flowers that bloom in the spring. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a fuzzy texture. Amsinckia mexicana is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and open habitats.
